primary.request: Check status of automatic maintenance fee withdrawal
primary.context: Customer expected an autopay withdrawal that has not yet occurred.
primary.detail: The customer disconnected after the agent repeatedly summarized the request without providing an answer or a transfer.

steps: Agent identified caller via phone number and verified name and state.
Customer explained that an automatic withdrawal for maintenance fees had not occurred.
Agent collected account number and resort name.
Agent summarized the request but failed to provide an answer or offer a transfer to a human for billing inquiry.
Customer became confused or impatient and disconnected.

failure.detail: The agent is unable to check autopay status or billing history and failed to proactively transfer the out-of-scope inquiry.

policy_gap.specific_gap: Checking status of scheduled automatic payments
policy_gap.customer_ask: Is my automatic withdrawal going to come out?
policy_gap.blocker: AI can only send payment links or look up basic account info, not verify pending bank transactions or autopay schedules.

clarifications.note: Agent clarifying mortgage vs maintenance fees.

loops.subject: payment status summary
loops.note: Agent repeating summary instead of acting.

insights.summary: The customer wanted to know why their automatic maintenance fee withdrawal hadn't processed. The agent collected all necessary details but then entered a loop of summarizing the request rather than transferring to a human who could check the billing system.
insights.verbatim: Supposed to be an automatic withdrawal, but it has not come out yet. Is it going to come out?
insights.coaching: When a customer asks about specific billing status or transaction history (which is out of scope), the agent should immediately offer a transfer to the billing or concierge department rather than continuing to collect data it cannot use.
